data: Once the variable has been assigned to for the first time it cannot be mutated due to the final keyword.
The variable is immutable, it's value cannot be changed after this assignment.
As I said for option 1, probability cannot be changed after this point, i.e. we cannot reassign to it, so it's immutable (with the final keyword).
since the final keyword is used, the variable 'probability' will be assigned to a random double and will not be subject to changes (will be immutable)
Since it is declared final we cannot modify it.
The variable probability is final and thus we cannot change its value after assigning something to it.
Here it uses the `final` word so that it cannot be changed.
Yes, since it is declared final this variable cannot be changed
The variable is final therefore cannot be changed.
the variable is defined as final, moreover the double type is not an heap object, implying that it will not be changed during runtime.
there's a final keyword so once assigned a value, it won't change
once assigned it cannot be reassigned or changed in any way
Final means that you can't change the reference of probability but it's actual value can change
yes, the variable is immutable, this value can't be modified anymore
the variable is defined as final and can't be modified
As it is created as a final variable, it value can't be change after it's creation.
The variable probability can't be changed after initialization
math.random() will generate a random number, which is stored in the immutable variable probability.

Using Math.random() we obtain a random double value. Once assigned to the probability variable it can not be modified.
